rule.name: Line too long
rule.description: Used when a line is longer than a given number of characters.

rule.name: Too many lines in a module
rule.description: Used when a module has too much lines, reducing its readability.

rule.name: Bad indentation.
rule.description: Used when an unexpected number of indentation\'s tabulations or spaces has been found.

rule.name: Mixed tab/space indentation
rule.description: Used when there are some mixed tabs and spaces in a module.

rule.name: Unnecessary semicolon
rule.description: Used when a statement is ended by a semi-colon (";"), which isn\'t necessary (that\'s python, not C ;).

rule.name: More than one statement on a single line
rule.description: Used when more than on statement are found on the same line.

messages.message: More than one statement on a single line

rule.name: Operator not preceded by a space
rule.description: Used when one of the following operator (!= | <= | == | >= | < | > | = | \+= | -= | \*= | /= | %) is not preceded by a space.

messages.message: Operator not preceded by a space

rule.name: Operator not followed by a space
rule.description: Used when one of the following operator (!= | <= | == | >= | < | > | = | \+= | -= | \*= | /= | %) is not followed by a space.

messages.message: Operator not followed by a space

rule.name: Comma not followed by a space
rule.description: Used when a comma (",") is not followed by a space.

messages.message: Comma not followed by a space

rule.name: Use of the <> operator
rule.description: Used when the deprecated "<>" operator is used instead of "!=".

rule.name: Use l as long integer identifier
rule.description: Used when a lower case "l" is used to mark a long integer. You should use a upper case "L" since the letter "l" looks too much like the digit "1"

messages.message: Use l as long integer identifier

rule.name: Use of the `` operator
rule.description: Used when the deprecated "``" (backtick) operator is used instead of the str() function.
